intro: Tithymalus agrarius, commonly known as the yellow tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its small yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tithymalus agrarius is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
